comment.author: 57099931@N05
comment._content:
It's interesting that approx 100 years later this report appeared in"de paper" about Miltown Malbay; Mr Paddy O'Donghaile, principal tax inspector, said it certainly did dawn on him when he was investigating in Miltown Malbay that it was happening elsewhere. ``It is happening all over the place. You can be lucky in an inquiry and in this one we were.''

 The taxmen swooped on the Bank of Ireland in the town before Christmas, 1991 and approached individual traders which resulted in disclosures and the ultimate recovery of about £2m in unpaid tax, including tax on deposit accounts where DIRT was not operated.
